subject: Mental Health
title: The Social Buffer Effect
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Social Buffer Effect.

hook.text: People with strong social connections live longer and handle stress better.

buildup.text: Social support lowers cortisol, blood pressure, and inflammation during stress.

discovery.text: Even holding a loved one's hand during pain reduces brain stress activation.

twist.text: Loneliness is as harmful to health as smoking 15 cigarettes a day.

climax.text: The quality of connections matters more than the quantity.

punchline.text: People are the best medicine for stress.

quiz.question: How harmful is chronic loneliness compared to other risks?
options: Equivalent to smoking 15 cigarettes a day
